info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 5:16AM EDT until September 27 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Virginia, including the following counties, Charlotte and Halifax.
* WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 511 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain has exited the area, leaving only light to moderate rainfall. However, rainfall totals of between 2.5 and locally 4 inches of rain were observed earlier tonight, much of it falling within about a 2 hour period. Area creeks and streams will remain high through 8 AM as the runoff from this rainfall continues to flow down these waterways.
- This includes the following streams and drainages... Double Branch, Gilliam Branch, Ellis Creek, Difficult Creek, Buckskin Creek, Ash Camp Creek, Armistead Branch, East Prong Difficult Creek, Bush Ford Branch, Austin Creek, Horsepen Creek, Catawba Creek and Black Walnut Creek.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include... Charlotte Court House... Nathalie... Drakes Branch... Mt Laurel... Saxe... Crystal Hill...
- For flooding safety information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.
